Description: Body fragment of North Ionian pottery bowl; interior glazed with added red band lined in white; exterior slipped white: band with traces of added colour between two friezes: above, maeander; below, lotus flower and bud frieze with slight traces of added colour.
Curator's comments: Very probably from same bowl as 1924,1201.1008, though the exterior dividing band is of as slightly different size.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.195)
